mods.note: 5. At? /- TELEGRAM ENCLAIR From Airways, Sharjah. Political Agent, Bahrain To Dated and received 6th July 1933. AW/65 6/7 Following from Residency Agent for P.R. Bushire. Shaikh of Dibai has been informed that his uncle Shaikh Ahmad bin Abaid of Henjam has been seized by the Persian Government and it was his intention to proceed to Bandar Abbas to investigate cause and come to some terms with the Persians aaa I accordingly proceeded to Bibai and advised Shaikh not to leave till I heard from you aaa Please advise early what action should be taken.Telegram G.T.C. & S .ho: T* Prom To No. Bated - Political, Bahrain. Resident, Bushire. 762. 6th July 1933. w Following from Residency Agent July sixth ' / - begins. Shaikh of Dibai has been informed that his uncle Shaikh Ahmed Bin Abaid of Hen jam has been : ^ -I seized by the Persian Government and it was his / / / intention to proceed to Bandar Abbas to investigate cause and come to some teimis with the Persians. I ' x S' / s accordingly proceeded to Dibai and advised Shaikh X f s / not to leave till I heard from you. please advise early what action should be taken, ends. I know / y i/ ^ nothing of present case but understand that Shaikh Ahmed was concerned in attack on Customs at Henjam y j / / in 1927 and fled to Dibai. Addressed Political Resident repeated S.N.O. Persian Gulf. -POLITICAL-Telegram G.T.C. From - Resident, Bushire. To - Political, Bahrain. Wo. - 529. Bated - 7th July 1933. Received 7.7.1333 (2010 lire). Addressed Bahrain repeated 3-W.O. Persian Gulf. Your telegremi Wo. 762. Residency Agent should he informed that I am making enquiries and that Shaikh of Behai should not visit Bandar Ahhas. Shaikh Ahmed after attack on Customs returned to Eea.1am in 1923 made his peace with Persian authorities and has been living there since. Has S.W.O. Persian Gulf any farther information. -RES IDEHT-Telegram:- Nos- From:- To Rptds- Your 529. According to Shaikh AHMAD 1 s nakhuda whose information is considered fairly reliable murdered Mudir*s son is clerk to Governor Bandar Abbas. Either mother or widow has claimed blood money for 1927 affair from AHMAD who repudiates liability. Governor Bandar Abbas sent for him to investigate. He was detained five days and was well treated. Evidence has been referred to Teheran. Bail of 20,000 Krans required before return to Hen jam was not available but property is valued at 28,000 Krans. He is now here awaiting permit to proceed to Arab coast where he has property.$, No â€¢ to > Nos- Telegram:- G.T*C. No:- 1843/8. Dated:- 8th July 1833. From:- S.N.O.P.G. To:- Resident Bushire. Rptd:- Political Bahrain. My 1429. Received indirect communication from Shaikh AHMAD stating he was locked up for eight days and was asked who Mudir 1 s murderer was. He gave written guarantee to appear if called upon* He has written to Shaikh of Dibai. Medium of message was not very intelligent but could use no other in the circumstances. Portion underlined was erroneously omitted when coded for transmission by W/T. NoteTelegram dated the 6th July 1933 from Airways Sharjah. Shaikh Ahmed Obaid of Henjam. Submitted for orders please. Copy of Residency Agents telegram telegraphed to the Political Resident withfc a copy to S.N.O.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/11 Shaikh Ahmad ibn Obaid of Heryan [Henjam] (Uncle of Shaikh of Dubai)'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. A series of serial numbers written in red crayon or pencil and appearing in the top right hand corner of the items of correspondence refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 11; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file relates to consultations and enquiries by British officials following the arrest of Sheikh Ahmad ibn Obaid of Henjam by the Persian Government. The Sheikh of Dubai, nephew of Sheikh Ahmad, wished to go Bandar Abbas to investigate the affair, but the British were keen to prevent his going. Sheikh Ahmad had apparently been detained and questioned about the identity of a murderer. The papers consist of telegrams between the Residency Agent, Sharjah; the Political Agent, Bahrain; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Senior Naval Officer, Persian Gulf.The covering dates of the correspondence (the main body of papers in this file) are 6 July 1933-10 July 1933. The closing date in the overall date range is supplied by an entry in the notes at the rear of the file.
